item.title: Actively AI raises $22.5M to offer sales ‘superintelligence,’ says AI SDRs failed
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description: Actively AI argues that most AI sales reps have "failed." It just raised $22.5 million.

item.title: Parasail says its fleet of on-demand GPUs is larger than Oracle’s entire cloud
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Cloud infrastructure is dominated by several large industry players: AWS, Microsoft’s Azure, and Google Cloud. While to some it may look like AI is headed in a similar direction, the founders of Parasail think AI infrastructure will look very different — and are betting their company’s fate on it. Parasail works with dozens of providers to […]

item.title: Patreon signs podcast partnerships with Sony and Wondery
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Patreon, a subscription platform for online creators, is ge has signed podcasting partnerships with Sony Music Entertainment and Amazon’s Wondery, the company announced on Wednesday. Patreon says the partnerships are designed to make the site a home to fan engagement and exclusive perks for shows from major podcast networks, as the company looks to expand […]

item.title: Roblox enables parents to block experiences and friends
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Roblox, the popular gaming platform geared toward preteens, has made substantial updates to its safety policy in the last year following accusations of insufficient safety measures for children, which could expose them to risks like grooming, explicit content, and violent material. The company announced Wednesday three new parental control features, including the option for them […]

item.title: Trump’s national security advisor reportedly used his personal Gmail account to do government work
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Michael Waltz used his personal Gmail to share "potentially exploitable" information, per the report.

item.title: AI crawlers cause Wikimedia Commons bandwidth demands to surge 50%
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description: The Wikimedia Foundation, the umbrella organization of Wikipedia and a dozen or so other crowdsourced knowledge projects, said on Wednesday that bandwidth consumption for multimedia downloads from Wikimedia Commons has surged by 50% since January 2024. The reason, the outfit wrote in a blog post Tuesday, isn’t due to growing demand from knowledge-thirsty humans, but […]

item.title: The Nintendo Switch 2 releases on June 5 and costs $450
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Nintendo unveiled new details on Wednesday about its hugely anticipated Nintendo Switch 2 gaming console, which will be the company’s first new console since the Nintendo Switch was introduced in 2017. The Nintendo Switch 2 will be released on June 5 and cost $450. At launch, the console will arrive both on its own and […]

item.title: Tesla records worst deliveries in two years amid Elon Musk backlash
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Tesla recorded 336,681 deliveries, its worst quarterly performance in more than two years as the brand suffers a backlash to CEO Elon Musk’s political maneuverings. The dip in sales comes as Musk continues leading DOGE, the “advisory body” that has laid off thousands of federal employees and attempted to eliminate entire agencies and programs. His […]

item.title: Rivian starts a challenging year with a big slip in deliveries
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Rivian delivered just 8,640 vehicles in the first three months of 2024, the company’s worst quarterly mark since the end of 2022. But the company says the slow start won’t impact its overall guidance for the year — it still expects to deliver between 46,000 and 51,000 EVs by the end of 2025. The company […]

item.title: Fourier is making hydrogen electrolyzers inspired by data centers
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Most recent hydrogen startups have been focused on making modular electrolyzers, but Fourier has taken that trend to the extreme.

item.title: Researchers suggest OpenAI trained AI models on paywalled O’Reilly books
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: OpenAI has been accused by many parties of training its AI on copyrighted content sans permission. Now a new paper by an AI watchdog organization makes the serious accusation that the company increasingly relied on non-public books it didn’t license to train more sophisticated AI models. AI models are essentially complex prediction engines. Trained on […]

item.title: CaaStle board confirms financial distress, furloughing employees
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: CaaStle, a startup that launched in 2011 as a plus-sized clothing subscription service and later became an inventory monetization platform for clothing retailers, is facing financial difficulties, the company confirmed to TechCrunch following a report by Axios. Citing a letter from the board, Axios reported that the company is almost out of money, CEO Christine […]

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz is trying to nab a piece of TikTok with Oracle, report says
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The venture capital firm is reportedly in talks to invest in TikTok as part of a bid led by Oracle and other American investors looking to buy out TikTok from ByteDance, according to the Financial Times. TikTok is once again slated to be banned in the U.S. on April 5 unless its Chinese-based owner sells […]

item.title: An accounting startup has turned tax preparations into a Pokémon Showdown game
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Accounting software company Open Ledger has launched a new product in time for tax day.  Meet PokéTax, a game that helps make tax filing quite fun. Instead of tax forms, users take on Tax Trainers — gym leaders — representing different parts of a tax form, such as income, deductions, and credits. Each leader asks […]

item.title: Who are climate-conscious consumers? Not who you’d expect, says Northwind Climate
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Rather than divide people into demographic buckets, Northwind Climate analyzes survey responses for behavioral clues.

item.title: Zelle is shutting down its app, but you probably don’t need to worry
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Zelle is shutting down its stand-alone app on Tuesday, according to a company blog post. This news might be alarming if you’re one of the over 150 million customers in the U.S. who use Zelle for person-to-person payments. But only about 2% of transactions take place via Zelle’s app, which is why the company is […]

item.title: Mark Cuban backs Skylight, a TikTok alternative built on Bluesky’s underlying technology
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Skylight, a startup taking on TikTok with a more open alternative, is launching its mobile app to the public on Tuesday after just 10 weeks of active development. The app, which is backed by Mark Cuban and others, is now one of many to build on top of the AT Protocol — the same technology […]

item.title: Meta’s head of AI research plans to leave the company
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Meta’s VP of AI research, Joelle Pineau, is planning to leave the company, she announced in a post on Facebook Tuesday. Pineau said she’s leaving in May after more than two years overseeing FAIR, Meta’s internal AI research lab led by Yann LeCun. Pineau’s exit comes as Meta ramps up its AI efforts, with the […]

item.title: TikTok is shutting down its Instagram competitor TikTok Notes
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: TikTok is shutting down its Instagram competitor, TikTok Notes, on May 8. The photo-sharing app launched in testing in Canada, Australia, and Vietnam last year. The company is notifying TikTok Notes users of its decision to retire the app and is directing them to ByteDance-owned Lemon8, which isn’t surprising given that the apps are quite […]

item.title: Genetic sharing site openSNP to shut down, citing concerns of data privacy and ‘rise in authoritarian governments’
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The open source repository of genetic data will delete its banks of data on April 30, its co-founder confirms.
